Job Posting:172035 - Position: F25 Coop Work Experience Student 172035B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 08/26/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 08/20/2025 01:40 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Alberta Health Services Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 Coop Work Experience Student 172035B Co-op Position Calgary, AB Canada 4 months CAD 17.53 per hour for 0 Major List Your Opportunity: Alberta Health Services (AHS) is Canada's first and largest province-wide, fully integrated health system, responsible for delivering health services to the over four million people living in Alberta, as well as to some residents of Saskatchewan, British Columbia, and the Northwest Territories. AHS provides a wide range of learning opportunities for students. The AHS IT team is one of the largest in Canada and has over 2500 employees across the province. The IT Team is a very dynamic and driven group who engage in complex, challenging and diverse projects to deliver collective results. Through quality work and innovative solutions, we meet the ever-changing needs of Albertans. Description: Join our dynamic IT Community Care Services team as a student contributor, where you'll gain hands-on experience and mentorship from seasoned IT professionals. This role offers a meaningful opportunity to apply your academic learning in a real- world setting, while developing key skills in creativity, adaptability, and collaboration within a geographically distributed workforce. As part of this team, you'll support IT systems and solutions for Population Public Health and Indigenous Health programs, with a focus on Communicable Disease Outbreak Management. Your contributions will include: Assisting in the creation of technical documentation. Supporting the development of sustainable IT solutions. Investigating and diagnosing system issues. Contributing to the stability and reliability of operational systems. This position is open to current students only. You must be actively enrolled and continuing your studies in the upcoming academic term. Applicants must reside in Alberta for the duration of the placement. Please note: relocation costs are not subsidized. Individuals who have graduated or will graduate prior to the placement start date are not eligible to apply. This position is open to current students only. You must be actively enrolled and continuing your studies in the upcoming academic term. Applicants must reside in Alberta for the duration of the placement. Please note: relocation costs are not subsidized. Individuals who have graduated or will graduate prior to the placement start date are not eligible to apply. • Classification: Coop Work Experience Student • Union: Students • Unit and Program: Information Technology, Community Care Services, Population Public Health and Indigenous Health • Primary Location: Quarry Crossing • Location Details: As Per Location • Negotiable Location: Within Calgary Zone • Temporary Employee Class: Student • FTE: 0.00 • Posting End Date: 26-AUG-2025 • Date Available: 15-SEP-2025 • Temporary End Date: 30-APR-2026 • Hours per Shift: 7.75 • Length of Shift in weeks: Varies • Shifts per cycle: Varies • Shift Pattern: Days • Days Off: Saturday/Sunday • Minimum Salary: $17.53 • Maximum Salary: $23.01 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable • Job Requirements Required Qualifications: Current enrolment in a co-op/work experience program in IT, Science, Engineering or Business-related field. Registered in a related field of study at a Canadian post-secondary institution. Additional Required Qualifications: Ability to work both independently and as part of a professional team. Ability to communicate confidently and professionally. Ability to take initiative and be responsible. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong presentation skills. Self-directed, highly motivated, results driven. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other computer applications. Preferred Qualifications: As Required. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.albertahealthservices.ca/jobs/coop-work-experience-student-530323 Application Deadline: August 26th, 2025 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
